body.name: Signature Fitness 3” x 3” Wall Mounted Fold-in Power Cage Squat Rack with Adjustable Pull Up Bar and J Hooks - Space-Saving Home Gym

features: Mounts into any wall and can be fully collapsed against wall to save space in your home gym - Dimensions: 57.5” x 24” x 78.5”
Fully adjustable J-Hook and Safety Spotter arm positions - 47 vertical holes and "westside" spacing on bottom half of each upright pole allowing for the perfect fit for any user's bench press
Built with 3"x3" 11-gauge steel - maximum stability and durability, holds up to 1,000lbs

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love it, but short---The only rack short enough to go under my garage door rail
reviews.reviewText: Pros- Great price, which allowed me to spend money on other nice things like a really nice bar and plate set.- Feels solid, it does all the things I need it to do- It is a lot thinner than other racks even when folded out.- The sidebars have a nice numbering system on them (make sure to install there facing out).Cons- Instructions are trash. Like complete trash, not helpful at all. It took me like 5 hrs to figure it out, YouTubing similar racks helps, but still.- Parts are not label. There are some bolts that are just slightly longer, which are important, but since there are not labeled you won’t realize this until you’re into it.- It came damaged. Now normally I would say that isn’t the company’s fault, but in this case, they very poorly wrapped a 80lb hunk of metal for shipping. It was only wrapped in one layer of cardboard + tape, so of course it is going to get thrashed. In this, we also lost one of the caps that goes on top of the legs- Silver hardware. They would look SO much cooler if the hardware was powder coated black… I literally might spray paint the bolts.- the pull-up bar bows. I am only 140lbs and the pull-up bar has a slight bow when I use it. Completely usable and no worries if it breaking, but it is there.Neutrals- height of the rack. This rack is short, BUT it is the only rack I could find that fit under my garage door track, so a positive for me but probably a con for others. You cannot do pull ups, TTB, etc without bending your knees.- J-Hooks. They are Narrow, so there isn’t a large margin for error when racking your bar, but they are plastic coated to protect your bar.Overall I’m very happy with my purchase. I would rather spend $350 with some of these cons than $1,000— plus this was the only rack short enough for my garage

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: works great, its sturdy and holds a good amount of weight.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good quality, horrible instructions
reviews.reviewText: Unit was delivered quickly and unlike other reviews, was packaged nicely. It arrived with no damage and all necessary components.Starting with the negative: the instructions are horrible. The various nuts and bolts aren’t labeled at all so taking a full inventory and counting piece by piece to know which part is which is the only way to do this. The QR code provided in the “instruction manual” takes you to an under construction page. Looking at the YouTube account for Signature Fitness gives you nothing related to this rack. I ended up watching a few videos of similar racks to get a general idea on the best way to install it.And some of the holes for the J hooks were too small. Had to round the holes out with a file to get the hooks in place.Pros: it’s actually a really nice rack. Folds up quickly so my wife can still get in the garage when she wants to. Feels very sturdy when set up and working out.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Pretty easy install. Its heavy which means good quality.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best value out there
reviews.reviewText: Very happy with my purchase, compared to anything on the market for a 3x3” rack this is the best value on the market.PROS:-Included stringers make installation easy regardless of stud location-Heavy duty 3x3” and 5/8” holes make it sturdy and compatible with many attachment-Height of the rack allowed it to fit under some HVAC, and I am 6’ tall and pull ups still work but the bar is about head height when standing-magnetized pins were a nice touch for locking the rack in positionCONS-Installation instructions are a bit confusing and need some math to figure out height of the stringers. There was a QR code for instructions but the link is dead-as the rack folds in and out there is some friction caused by rotating on the threads of a bolt, would have been better to have a bushing. I plan on lubricating to help-no pin for locking the pull up bar, I wouldn’t say it’s required to use but would have been good to include-j cups are a little shallow, haven’t had any issue but was used to deeper onesOverall very happy with the rack, looking forward to adding some accessories and increasing its utility.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The criticisms are valid. The instructions are garbage and the measurements mostly useless. Here’s what you should do:1. Hold an upright bar to the wall. Look in the manual for the exact pegs that the bolts will go into on the back. Mark both sides on the wall. In my case I needed to move the bottom bracket up one rung to clear crown moulding. Drill and use your preferred screw type (I used normal style screws.) 2. Attach the bottom bracket by the left and right most top screws. Make sure it’s level. Do the same for the top bracket. Don’t tighten anything yet! 3. Attach the arms and upright posts. If one side does not fully touch the ground and the brackets are level then your surface isn’t entirely level. (My garage floor was not.) Don’t panic it is probably fine or you can order metal shims from Rogue!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The rack itself is excellent. Solid and well built. Delivery was quick and no damage to the packaging or contents.The issue is with the company’s quality control and customer service. Was missing a locking nut which was not a big deal because you can pick those up at any hardware store for a buck. However, also missing one of the swivel pins that lock the uprights into place - pretty important part for a folding wall rack. Completely unusable at this point.I’ve emailed the company and submitted inquiries via the website numerous times without a response. For these reasons I had to deduct a couple of stars.

I wanted a folding rack for my small basement gym and this was the right choice. It’s not too tall so it works well with my low ceilings. I’m doing a Reno in the basement so I temporarily installed this unit until the gym is completed. Install was as expected, if you’re good with your hands you’ll have no problems. This rack can support heavy weights, it’s heavy duty. I would have given a 5 but there were some small cosmetic imperfections (ex: numbers not punched out, paint defects, metal bends…) but given the price I paid when the rack was on sale I’m very happy with the purchase.
